New Records: Ezequiel Tovar became the first Rockies player with 40 or more doubles since Charlie Blackmon hit 42 in 2019. Tovar is just the second Colorado shortstop to hit 40 doubles, joining Trevor Story, who hit 42 in 2018.
Key Match Events: Brenton Doyle finished a triple short of the cycle, hitting a double in the second, a solo homer in the third, and an RBI single in the sixth.
Brendan Rodgers hit solo homers in the third and fourth innings and added an infield single in the sixth. It was the second multi-homer game of Rodgers’ career.
Rookie catcher Drew Romo hit a two-run double off the right-field fence in Colorado’s four-run fourth.
Derek Hill led Miami’s parade, going 3-for-6 with two homers and three RBIs as the Marlins recorded a season-high 18 hits.
Post-Match Reflections: Brendan Rodgers commented, 'It was good to have yesterday off and get a little rest. I put some good swings on the ball.'
Bradley Blalock reflected, 'We had a plan coming in, but it didn’t fall our way. But props to their hitters. I just have to be better next time.'

Manager Bud Black stated, '(Blalock) wasn’t quite sharp. He’s learning through these first few handful of starts about the difference between facing major league hitters and minor league hitters and the importance of every pitch counting. Not throwing a good pitch and then a poor one. The consistency of quality pitches is something that he has to continue to focus on, and it will be his challenge as a major league starting pitcher.'
Miscellaneous Highlights: Miami reliever Jesus Tinoco pitched 2 1/3 innings and picked up his first career victory. Tinoco was part of the Rockies’ 2015 trade, sending star shortstop Troy Tulowitzki to Toronto.
